keyTakeAways: A cargo plane operated by Turkish cargo carrier ACT Airlines skidded off the runway at Hong Kong International Airport (HKIA) during landing from Dubai, breaking in two.
The aircraft collided with an airport security patrol car, which was located on the runway, pushing it into the sea and killing two occupants.
The plane was partially submerged, with its tail section snapped off and significant damage to the front section below the cockpit.
All four crew members on board were treated for injuries and confirmed safe.
The aircraft did not send any distress signals, indicating a possible lack of pilot awareness of the malfunction.
No cargo was on board, and the flight was wet-leased by Emirates from ACT Airlines, which provides cargo capacity to major airlines.
The airport suspended operations on the north runway for safety and recovery, though two other runways remained operational, minimizing flight disruptions.
Over 200 people, fire engines, and boats were involved in the emergency response.
Hong Kong International Airport is one of the world's busiest and has a low historical rate of fatal aviation accidents, making this incident notable despite its rarity.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A cargo plane operated by Turkish cargo carrier ACT Airlines skidded off the runway at Hong Kong International Airport (HKIA) during a landing from Dubai around 3:50 a.m. local time, breaking in two and colliding with an airport security patrol car. The collision pushed the vehicle into the sea, killing two occupants. All four crew members on board were treated and survived. The aircraft did not transmit any distress signals, and there was no cargo on board. The incident led to a large emergency response involving over 200 people, fire engines, and boats. The north runway was suspended, but operations on the other two runways continued, minimizing flight disruptions. The flight was wet-leased from ACT Airlines by Emirates, which provided cargo capacity to major airlines. This event is notable given Hong Kong’s reputation for aviation safety, with only one major fatality in its history at HKIA, highlighting the rarity and significance of the incident.
title: Two Killed as Cargo Plane Skids Off Runway into the Sea in Hong Kong
